name: rocked
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
rock
rock verb
(MOVE)
C2 [ I or T ] to (cause someone or something to) move backwards and forwards or from side to side in a regular way: He picked up the baby and gently rocked her to sleep. If you rock back on that chair, you're going to break it.
[ T ] If a person or place is rocked by something such as an explosion, the force of it makes the person or place shake: The explosion, which rocked the city, killed 300.
More examplesFewer examplesThe nurse rocked the cradle.He rocked the cradle with a gentle backwards and forwards motion.He tried to calm the screaming baby by rocking it back and forth.She was gazing out the window, rocking rhythmically to and fro.He rocks in his sleep.

rock verb
(SHOCK)
[ T ] If an event rocks a group of people or society, it causes feelings of shock: The managing director's resignation rocked the whole company.

rock verb
(WEAR SUCCESSFULLY)
[ T ] slang to wear a particular style of clothing, etc. and look good or fashionable: There are celebrities over 40 years old who can still rock a tattoo.
